buginformation.summary: Switching accounts while loading statuses displays previous accounts statuses in new account's lane
buginformation.description: This was spun off #34 (and not directly related). If you, ideally on a slow connection, start loading on tweets on account 1 (scroll down until you get "Loading") and then quickly switch to account 2, the statuses from account 1 are loaded into the lane for account 2.

buginformation.summary: In account switcher, use icon instead of names
buginformation.description: Currently (App.net) and (Twitter) follow the account name. This causes long account names to cut off (App.net) or (Twitter).

Currently, we fetch 50 statuses at a time. With rate limiting, you can reach your limit pretty fast if you haven't fetched in a while. I've previously set it to 100, but users on slow data connections have to wait twice as long to get data and complained. Proposal: Get a small number, say 25, show those, and while the user is reading those 25 fetch the max (250 or so).

Add a option to have absolute time in the lanes vs relative time.
When choosing to share something to tweetlanes you go to direct message screen, and nothing in compose box. Should go to main timeline with share text in compose box

Tweetlanes seems to be able to forget the list position. You have lots of lanes set up a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i (d to i could be lists, but this can also be reproduced on timeline and mentions etc). Open app refresh an active lane (i.e. lane g) with a few (i.e. 15) new tweets. Scroll to top of lane (i.e. lane g). Swipe two (or more) lanes left (i.e. to lane e) or right (i.e. to lane i) Swipe back to lane g position is back to what it was before reloading lane at 1. You can make it remember position by swiping 1 left or right then back to lane or not fully scrolling to the top (although this can be temperamental and cause other lanes to jump to top, however this specific jump may be unrelated as i haven't been able to reproduce on the build BlythMeister supplied today). You can also open tweet detail and go back to lane, or exit app and reopen and it will remember the last position. If you need some lists to subscribe to for checking with multiple lanes, there are a few busy ones here:- https://twitter.com/London2012/lists/olympians https://twitter.com/NASA/lists/astronauts There are plenty of others, or make your own - tweetlanes is awesome with lots of lists ;)

1.3.0 added a reduced cache to prevent out of memory errors. This is causing some users annoyance. Add config to enable a user to overide the tweetlanes recommend cache size.

The example i have seen is that an instagram link with a capital I will not be regarded as a media link. The string checking for types of link (by definition of using java) is case sensitive. Both sides of the comparison should have their case the same. Also to note, on a lot of these types of links, the case of the "code" needs to remain in tact.

When refreshing in landscape with camera on the right, the screen rotates a full 180, then back again. Would guess the lock rotate is having strange effects.
Make the UI update before HTTP requests complete. This will make the UI feel faster. Will need to make sure that on HTTP request fail the UI reverts to previous state and notifies the user.
Make a change log show up as a pop up after updating. This is where we can show who contributed to the most recent build. Kinda like Press. I will upload a screenshot tonight.
When refreshing, if you have more unread than the max reteival about, the client jumps to the top of the previous refresh. (hope that makes sense, dificult to explain & repo)
Once an image is attached to a message, there is no way to get rid of it. This would (at one stage) have been done using the clear "X" button that we got rid of a couple of releases ago.

Auto link now puts http at start of link. If I put the text app.net Twitter make this a t.co. When it's displayed, it gets http:// put on front. Not sure if we can stop it, but makes some text look funny. In particular when talking about something .net. I.e app.net, asp.net, vb.net.

buginformation.summary: Large font size setting clips user names in TL view
buginformation.description: See the screenshot. When you choose the Large font size in the settings, the font size of the user name is also larger and the lower part of the character (most stuff under the baseline) is clipped. This does not happen if you choose any other font size. With any other font size, from Extra small to Extra large, the font size of the user name appears to stay the same. Hence no clipping. Only when you choose the Large font, the user names are also displayed larger and get clipped.
A fullstop the @ doesn't show auto complete. Also, I seem to be missing people I follow on my auto complete.
When you get a notification for dm, would expect the dm lane to load, not the mention one.
Work on action being a success unless otherwise stated. Only show toast for errors.
Character count doesn't take into account the attached image url length. When image attached, a set number of extra characters should be added.

buginformation.summary: Delete tweet from cache on callback
buginformation.description: Currently, tweets are removed straight away, not after callback completes.

buginformation.summary: Show some sort of interaction/animation/feedback when favoriting a tweet
buginformation.description: Would be nice to see some sort of visual after pressing the favorite (star) icon. Right now it can take several seconds for a tweet to become "favorite". Currently i look to see if there's any network activity to see if it's "working"

buginformation.summary: Tap a link in a tweet - incorrect behaviour
buginformation.description: Steps to reproduce:- Find tweet with a link to user/hashtag/link. Click link on the tweet Tweet detail is opened (or url if external link) - Unwanted action Press back or close browser and the users profile/hashtag search is opened - this is what should have been shown at 3 Press back again to take you to the tweet list. What should happen: click username/hashtag/link within tweet user profile/search/url opens press back to return to tweet list This may have been caused by this merge as I never noticed this behaviour prior to this:- #9

buginformation.summary: Whole tweet not passed back from spotlight
buginformation.description: Only RT and favorite info passed back, other bits aren't. For example number of retweets.
reported by @xodeus on twitter. On looking into the image, the details are as follows: 3.7mb image at a resolution of 4208 x 3120. It is believed that tweetlanes should be resizing the image.

buginformation.summary: Sharing a post from App.Net provides a Twitter URL instead
buginformation.description: Hi! This is my first post here, so I hope I didn't miss anything. Using Android 4.2 and Tweet Lanes 1.3.0 When sharing a post from App.Net and selecting "Link to Tweet", it shares a wrong URL: https://twitter.com/username/status/12345678 Instead of this URL from App.Net: https://alpha.app.net/username/post/12345678 Besides, "Link to Tweet" could also be changed to "Link to Post" to match ADN's terminology. Thanks!
When choosing quote shouldn't mark as RT.

buginformation.summary: Can't tell which account posting too
buginformation.description: You don't know how often I post to the wrong account. Mostly personal tweets to tweetlanes :( Can we work out a way to show which account in the app? Maybe change the logo to the account picture when composing a new post?

buginformation.description: Reported by @mls768: couple of weeks ago I found that some @TweetLanes api are done over http since I was able to see full http api request on wireshark. All calls should be HTTPS.

buginformation.summary: Holo Light w/Dark action bar missing conversation icon
buginformation.description: The new theme seems to not load the conversation icon until you click on it. See below... Middle one is the one missing the arrow, left shows it after it's been clicked on and right shows that the icon is fine on dark theme - also fine on light theme.

A few of the other Twitter clients for Android have larger previews for inline media (spanning the width of the text area), instead of a small thumbnail floated to the right of the text. Should this be considered for TweetLanes too? Reasons: It looks a bit slicker when scanning the timeline, as elements are more aligned. It's easier to see the content of the image in a (slightly) larger preview.
When deleting a status it doesn't disapear from timeline. Report for spam does Investigate differences and mirror code :-)

Changes in 1.2.1 only refresh normal lanes on send, not dm lanes and dm drill downs.
(re)Add refresh on start and account switch.
All new status in the cache, but the number new isn't, so bar doesn't show how many new status there are.
Add symbol on dm lane to show if last message was from other person, or is your reply.
Fir some reason there is an option to block the current user. Also there is no place to unblock users (I.e. to remove myself from the list). when I tried to block myself the app forced closed.
When refreshing if there is no new status position is off my a couple of pixels. Means you can't just pull again, but need a little scroll first.
The number always seems to be one lower than actual. I.e. 3 new tweets, bar says 2.

buginformation.summary: Tweetlanes forgets the last viewed lane on opening
buginformation.description: Occasionally rather than displaying the last viewed lane (usually the timeline) Tweetlanes will display another lane when opened. In my case this is usually the "My Tweets" lane, though this may depend on the order of the lanes and which you have visible. Ideally you should be able to mark a lane as default and have it always open there, or opt to display whichever lane was visible when the app was closed.

buginformation.summary: New posts/tweets bar will reappear after reading all new posts
buginformation.description: The "{count} New Posts" blue bar will reappear in the lanes after viewing all new posts. To reproduce: Go to a lane with new posts, Scroll to the top until the message appears, Scroll a few posts back down, When scrolling up the blue bar will reappear.

buginformation.summary: Clicking on twitter picture links prompts to open in Tweet Lanes, then doesn't do anything
buginformation.description: No description provided.
If screen rotates, results can get lost and position goes wrong. Generally not good. Idea to actually stop the rotate function when pull to refresh running.
When pressing the save image button in the image viewer, 2 copies are saved. One in dcim/camera/ folder and a second in pictures/tweet lanes/

buginformation.summary: Status' not being passed back from spotlight
buginformation.description: This is a blocker on the release. Needs to be fixed before we can put out...sorry.
Notification often has the wrong number of new mentions. Not sure if dm notifications also effected.
When pull to refresh in landscape screen goes back to protrait after refresh.
Is it possible to add an option NOT to show Inline Image previews? The image should still probably load when going to the tweet (detail) screen, just not in the timeline/lane.

buginformation.description: When I star or retweet a post the corner of the post does not show the star or retweet corner. (I'm very sleepy so I hope this makes sense)
